intro: Pachira orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco pachira, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, woody trunk and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that are followed by orange or red fruits containing several seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
